page.title: 19Hellifield Playing Field
page.content: In 1979 Hellifield Parish Council were approached to provide land and facilities for village recreation. Several abortive attempts had been made since 1924. A piece of derelict land was leased from Craven District Council in 1980 and a Management Committee of 7 villagers coopted.Over Â£1000 has been raised annually to maintain and equip the field,after clearance by the villagers. The long term plan is to provied children's adventure equipment,tennis court,bowling green,and pavilion /social club.The wooden play equipment ,seating and field oven/barbecue have been produced by village craftsmen and local school children. Mowing and other maintenance is done voluntarily. Much use has been made of second_hand and donated materials.
